thread.title: 7 things to know about today, plus how Florida's community college system ranks
thread.title_full: 7 things to know about today, plus how Florida's community college system ranks

author: Cindy Barth
title: 7 things to know about today, plus how Florida's community college system ranks
text: 7 things to know about today, plus how Florida's community college system ranks Sep 2, 2015, 6:45am EDT Industries & Tags Cindy Barth Editor Orlando Business Journal Home of the Day Enlarge Thinkstock Images We know we have a great community college system here in Central Florida. But have you ever wondered how the state of Florida, as a whole, ranks compared to other states in the U.S.? Florida has the fifth-best community college system in the U.S., according to a new report by personal financial website WalletHub . The list draws upon WalletHub's rankings of 670 community colleges, including technical and vocational schools, based on cost and financing, classroom experience, educational outcomes and career outcomes. WalletHub then calculated a weighted average between scores obtained by colleges in each state and the number of students enrolled in each school. The top 10 states with the best community college systems are, in ranked order: Mississippi, North Dakota, Wyoming, Washington, Florida, Arkansas, Nevada, Montana, Wisconsin and California. And be sure to check out these other Wednesday headlines: Hilton taps 'sharing economy' with Uber partnership Hotel giant Hilton is getting a taste of the sharing economy and helping guests hail a ride with its new partner, Uber . The partnership comes in the form of an Uber feature in the hotel chain’s HHonors app. Guests can set Uber “ride reminders” through the Hilton app or site and get automated notification on the day of travel to remind them when to request a ride. While Uber and Lyft drivers are already picking up and dropping off riders at hotels throughout the country frequently, the integration is designed to help Hilton guests seamlessly hail a ride without leaving the hotel app and to “say goodbye to long taxi lines,” since the hotel’s address is automatically set in the Uber app. Uber entered the Central Florida market early last year. Read more here . Noodles & Company opening new restaurant on Sept. 15 Noodles & Company officially opens its new South Orange Avenue location in Orlando on Tuesday, Sept. 15, as previously reported by Orlando Business Journal . The restaurant will open at 11 a.m. and is located at 2855 S. Orange Ave. — the fourth Noodles location to open in Florida. Noodles & Company also recently introduced a new catering program that will be available at the new location. The 2,752-square-foot South Orange Avenue Noodles & Company has seating for 65 guests inside the dining room and 26 guests on the outside patio. Florida's consumer confidence up despite Wall Street Consumer confidence across Florida grew slightly from July to August, but the numbers might not fully reflect the recent roller-coaster ride of the stock market, according to a University of Florida report released Monday. The university's Survey Research Center in the Bureau of Economic and Business Research placed consumer sentiment at 91.2, up from 90.5 in July, on a consumer-confidence scale that ranges from 2 to 150. The latest number reflects perceptions by consumers that the U.S. economy will be better in the next year and the next five years, with the monthly figure balanced by an expectation by most consumers that their personal incomes will decline over the next year. FMLA rules and timeframes your company must know When an employee puts you on notice of the need for time off under the Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA), the paperwork begins and the clock starts ticking. If you’re new to the process or don’t deal with the FMLA very often, that gentle tick-tick-tick can start to sound like a clanging gong. Tension can reverberate when you’re sorting through forms and deadlines loom. Breaking down the paperwork that’s involved can help make leave designation less stressful. Click here to read about five things you need to take care of throughout the FMLA process. Trending this morning on Google Business
